website_summaries.verdict: As long as you don't need 3D compatibility, the LG BD570 offers the same mix of solid Blu-ray playback and media streaming that made its predecessor a hit.
pros: Netflix, Vudu, YouTube, Pandora, and CinemaNow streaming
plays music, videos, and pictures off a connected USB drive or via network
cons: no quick-start mode, which makes it feel slower compared with some other players
must change the output mode to 1080p

customer_reviews.title: average features
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 8 years ago and still have it so it lasted a long time. Since it is old, expect the features it has to be outdated. If you are very much into technology, this will be disappointing for you. But if you are an old schooler like me, this is fine
customer_reviews.author: Juni

customer_reviews.title: LG BD570
customer_reviews.text: This is such an excellent BD player. It's replacing a Sony PS3. While the PS3 has great bang for the buck (game box, media server, internal HD, BD player), it's got one huge fault that I can no longer tolerate: the fan is too bloody loud! It all but drowns out the audio, so back into the box and say hello to the LG BD 570. Which is silent. Ahhhh. Setup was easy. Netflix activation was instantaneous, as was connecting to YouTube, Pandora, Picasa, and Accuweather. Streaming movies from my PC to the LG using Tversity was simplicity itself. I highly recommend this player if you need networked capabilities such as a media server and streaming Netflix movies. Outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Bagman

customer_reviews.title: Great Blu Ray
customer_reviews.text: I have this player for a few years now. And it has worked flawlessly. No issues whatsoever. It plays blu Ray and standard DVDs with no problem. I also use this player to screen Netflix with no problems there either. I have even plugged my external hard drive into the USB port and played video files from my drive and displayed photo files. Very good player for the price.
customer_reviews.author: L.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good - with drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I've been happy with the player. I've purchased other DVD players that would freeze up, or skip, and were very touchy about the disk. This one was very easy to set up, and has a nice remote. The unit itself is very space conscious, taking up just a few inches of height. Sleek design, easy to use, and very smooth, nice quality playback. The biggest disappointment for me is that it does NOT stream Amazon web input. Maybe you just can't have it all.
customer_reviews.author: R. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Go back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.text: They haven't worked the kinks out of this DVD Blu-ray player. The remote control buttons get stuck, so you often have to push a button several times before it works (very annoying). The device often stops in the middle of DVD or CD playback, and you have to turn it off and back on again to get it to restart (super annoying). Live streaming WiFi: we've situated it closer to our wireless router than any of our other live streaming devices (PS3, Wii), but unlike the others, this DVD player drops the signal often and has to be reset often. This, along with the constant rebuffering, and the fact that it does not stream amazon.com, is beyond annoying--it's tragic.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia160

customer_reviews.title: LG Simple
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-ray gets the job done. It took me about 5 minutes to get the cables plugged in, linked to my receiver and TV, and working ASAP. The initial set-up walks you through getting the network (WI-Fi or wired internet connection) set-up and allows you to update your firmware and preview the Netcast feature. I own an LG LED TV, so this made it even better, because the "Simplink" technology automatically links the two together. I pop-in a Blu-Ray, and my TV automatically converts to the Blu-Ray input and adjust the video settings. I also like the audio, MP3, and USB drive settings for pictures and music.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent P. Meno

customer_reviews.title: Works okay as a Netflix device, but not for playing discs.
customer_reviews.text: The Netflix interface on this device is okay. (You can't search on it and it is slow, but functional) As documented in other reviews, mine overheats when playing DVDs. So I use it for Netflix only. Have watched maybe 20 DVDs on it in the 3 years I've owned it. They eventually stop playing and you have to cool the unit down. I use my older Phillips DVD/DVR unit to play DVDs now. Very frustrating that you buy a device labeled as 'X' and it does not do 'X' very well - Like a cell phone that does not make good calls (but surfs the web well)
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted a multi player for DVD and Blu-Ray and because it could also be used to access Netflix and YouTube. We love the DVD, Blu-Ray, and Netflix capabilities. My only quarrel is with accessing YouTube, where you can't access your own channel at all and the search function is very laborious, where the letter-by-letter selection process via the remote can be a real pain. I'm hoping LG (or YouTube?) improves the software for this. I also wish the machine had an actual on/off button so that you wouldn't necessarily have to use the remote to turn it on. All that said, it has worked flawlessly, it's slim and compact, and quite easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: In The Night Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Play Everything!
customer_reviews.text: Beware that this player will not play all Blu-ray media. According to LG's tech support, Disney has released recent movies (The King's Speech, Tangled, and Tron: Legacy) with 7.1 DTS-HD Master Audio encoding and the LG devices haven't yet been updated to address it. As he portrays it, the codec has been experimental until recently. According to other sources it "has been steadily becoming the standard". At any rate, LG says they are working on a firmware update- eta unknown. In the meantime, if you're looking for something that will reliably play whatever you want to watch, this isn't the device for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soooo much easier...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Blu Ray player, so I can't compare how the disk performs compared to other models. I CAN say that for streaming internet TV, particularly Netflix, this is much much easier to set up than Samsung's web interface. I had tried to get my Samsung TV to stream and I never could get it to play nicely with my Airport Extreme wireless router. This LG, however, was truly plug and play. And the streaming picture looks fantastic (and I am very picky about picture quality). My only concern is that I haven't found a way to add additional apps. It's preloaded with Netlflix, YouTube, Vudu and others. But what about Amazon and Hulu?
customer_reviews.author: It's Moot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, great price, easy to install, loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a blue ray in my budget and decided on this LG based on previous reviews. I was not disappointed. I had it installed within ten minutes out of the box, and had signed onto netflix within the next five. Performance has been flawless but for two events when there was a pause for loading partway through the movie. However, considering how much I've used it, the problems were few and insignificant. I know this may also be due to my wireless, the source of which is located in a bedroom upstairs. I love being able to go so easily into netflix,and picture quality is so good I rarely pull out my DVD's anymore.
customer_reviews.author: JSB

customer_reviews.title: 5-Star Features but only 3-Star Performance
customer_reviews.text: The feature set of the BD570 is 5-star worthy. However, the frailty of the firmware drops the overall score to a 3. 24p capability, which is what I primarily purchased this unit for, has been an intermittent problem. With the latest firmware as of the end of December 2010, 24p currently causes many Blu-Ray discs to skip chapters multiple times. You can change the setting to 60p and mostly eliminate the issue, but then you introduce unwanted jitter on pans and scans. If LG can finally fix this issue once and for all, then I will solidly endorse the BD570 with 5-stars. Until then, it gets only 3.
customer_reviews.author: ItsameaMario

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Wireless Player!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a Christmas gift and helped to set it up. When I opened the box I was a little disappointed because the front hinge on the cover was popped out - and I was worried that the player was broken. We continued to set it up and it worked fine. Easy setup! Connected to the wireless network in minutes! Blu-Ray disc loaded fast and played as expected. Easy to navigate on-screen menus. Lots of "extras" like netflix and youtube to play with! I don't know why manufactures don't include HDMI cables yet! So, make sure you buy one before you set this up.
customer_reviews.author: David Allen

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Blu-ray player!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this player yesterday. It replaced a Vizio that had similar features. This LG is by far a superior player. The set up took a total of 15 minutes, which included going on line to get a Netflix activation code. The menu & on screen set up is completely user firendly. The remote is light years ahead of the Vizio in terms of speed. Wireless connectivity signal is strong. About the only negative I can add, is that the AAA batteries were dead. No big deal. I find it hard to believe you can find a better wireless enabled DVD player of this quality & price anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good DVD player. It has built in wireless so that was a major plus. It installed very easily and was up and working within 10mins. My only complaint is that it seems to need to upgrade about once a month, and that does take some time. We have incredibly fast download speeds and it still takes about 7-8 minutes for the dvd to get the download and then apply it. But that is kinda being nit-picky...the unit works great and we aren't looking to replace it. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: erik

customer_reviews.title: not really wireless!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this Life's Good product - easy to set up, clear software, user friendly, excellent play quality. THE ONLY PROBLEM IS WIRELESS RANGE - 10'. IF I ONLY NEEDED 10' OF DISTANCE FROM MY WIRELESS ROUTER, I WOULD HAVE HARD WIRED IT !!! Constantly drops out and has to rebuffer when streaming Netflix movies LG says wireless card in DVD is not as good as Laptop, which functions perfectly @ 40'. DVD has LIMITED RANGE ... I would not have paid the Premium for a wireless DVD had I known. Jim Fitch St Louis
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, stylish, wireless media hub
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an LG 42 inch lCD tv for a great deal on presidents day, and this little box is its' perfect compliment. I stream netflix, watch bluray's, and stream wirelessly from my iMac upstairs. Setting up my iMac for the file sharing was probably the most challenging part of setup, but a quick Google search led me in the right direction. The player is quiet, and loads quickly, and even has an iPhone remote app. So far everything is working smoothly. I will update if any problems should arise. Excellent device, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mathieu J. Champagne

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. It did take a couple of times for me to upgrade the software. I love the stream from Netflix. I use the HDMI hook up and it helps with better clarity. Lets face it, DVD is better clarity, but the stream is very doable and I don't have to plug in my laptop anymore! . Not the fault of the player. They have acu weather that you can plug in different zip codes to check the weather. I haven't had a chance to check Pandora out yet, but plan to this weekend. Other stream options I have not had the opportunity to check out. All in all. A great player.
customer_reviews.author: Guitarbythefire

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since early august and it does have a lot of cool features,like Pandora internet radio but it will no longer play a DVD movie which is very frustrating. Usually it either stops somewhere in the middle of the movie or will not play it at all!!! So now I have bring back my old DVD player to play movies,which is 4yrs. old I will be contacting LG but it only has 3 month warranty and player is 4 months old. Considering this is my first LG product,I'm not impressed it might be my last one too.
customer_reviews.author: G. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Illusory warranty, mediocre product
customer_reviews.text: The LG BD570 boots slowly, loads slowly, plays slowly, and ejects slowly. When it works, it works fine. Mine worked for 8 months, then the Ethernet cable connector went dead. After troubleshooting with Customer Support, I was told the warranty covers labor for only 90 days, and parts for 1 years. The cost of labor would be $70, and it would take 3-4 weeks plus shipping time to service the defective product. This was not a bottom-of-the-line BD/DVD player pricewise. It is definitely one quality-wise.
customer_reviews.author: Zorro

customer_reviews.title: Everything at my fingertips
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed with the LG BD570 Blu-ray. Streaming from Netflix, playing movies off my home computer, even surfing Youtube. Wireless wasnt too hard to set up although I have had to re-set it up a few times (static vs dynamic ip problem I am guessing). The only complaint I can think of is some bad grammer in some of the home screens and the transition between screens after you make a choice is a little slow. I would guess these will be addressed in future firmwware updates. Otherwise, this Blu-ray does the job it advertises!
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: LG BD570 with built-in wireless
customer_reviews.text: Excellent networked player. Up and running in 30 minutes without looking at the manual. Very intuitive setup. HDMI to 32" Sony LCD @ 720P. Picture quality of Blu-Ray is awesome. Upconvert from standard dvds is very good. Biggest surprise was the quality of the networked movies. I use Netflix exclusively and it was better than expected. I am running cable @ 7mb+ which, I'm sure, is one of the reasons for the great pic. Built-in wireless was an essential feature for me. Price was less than expected. You'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskey Cobra

customer_reviews.title: fantastic product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This product surpasses my expectations. The quality, Ease of use and the look and performance of this item is top notch. The speed of this purchase to arrive at my home was exactly as promised, and the description of the unit was right on. Not only am I satisfied with product but very happy with Amazon`s professional and speedy service, I have purchased 18 various items so far from Amazon.com and have been completely satisfied. I will always buy from Amazon.com David Schultz
customer_reviews.author: D. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Operation
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two LG BD570 network Blu-ray players. I am 70 years old and not up to date on all the latest set up,etc. Both of the players were plug and go without any problems on my wireless network. Both units were linked to my televisions via the basic Amazon HDMI cables. No need to purchase the expensive cables that most people are told will increase the preformance. I also set up Netflix on both in about 15 minutes and the movies from Netflix are great. Next up is setting up the free radio programs.
customer_reviews.author: Headgasket

customer_reviews.title: Where is Netflix???
customer_reviews.text: Just received this device and was setting it up. All seems really intuitive, and easy. Got it connected to wifi network in like 2minutes. Watched a little bit of Wall-E blu ray and the picture is INSANELY clear. However, what am I missing? I go into Netcast and all I see if Youtube, PIcasa and AccuWeather. A main selling point for this purchase was netflix.... I went and updated the software to latest and greatest, still no joy. Anyone have ideas???
customer_reviews.author: Shaun A. Whitehorse

customer_reviews.title: All-around solid performance and rich features
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this DVD Player for a year now without any issues. I set it up in my home movie theater in the second floor while my wireless router is in my office in the first floor. Never had any issues with streaming video from Netflix and other providers. I specially like DivxTV where I get CBS Nightly news plus tons of technology updates from cnet. From time to time the DVD player gets firmware update and that takes sometime to complete but I later learned there is a way to run that in the background.
customer_reviews.author: Omer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I know other Blu Ray players are cheaper, or might have an extra feature or two. However, this one has worked wonders for me. I finally got to throw away the pricey, unreliable Charter cable in exchange for Netflix. I'm glad to finally have a variety of things to pick from, even things that were on cable for only 9 bucks a month. There's also Pandora and Napster music on it, and other features that you can purchase. It loads quick, and it even hooks up nicely to my home theater system via an optical cable.
customer_reviews.author: Monsieur Connoisseur

customer_reviews.title: love it, sexy and functional.
customer_reviews.text: It's so small compared to some blu-ray players it seems remarkable how it packs so many features into the tiny package. I was impressed at how easily I was able to set it up [20 min including opening the box] to watching the first disk. It connected to the internet quickly and synced to my netflix account easily. I only have basic computer skills and it was very intuitive. The image looks great too. I think the only downside is how slow the updates can be, but that is so infrequent that it doesn't really matter.
customer_reviews.author: Nutterbutter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent video from Blu-Ray, so-so from Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Samsung Blu-Ray HTIB with this Blu-Ray player and a Denon receiver. Super video quality with Blu-Ray - impressive! Not so pleased with the quality of the Netflix streaming, though. My retired (due to failure) Samsung player did a better job with streaming Netflix. Not such a big deal for me since I'm not as concerned with Netflix streaming capability as with Blu-Ray. That being said, there are probably players out there that strike a better performance balance with both. Overall, satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Diggler

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get.
customer_reviews.text: Netflix is wonderful to watch on the LG BD570. Just wish there was a search feature for netflix. Upconversion on regular DVD's looks fantastic. Had an issue with youtube, but just be sure to put in the primary DNS of your internet service and you won't run into any problems with "network congestion" error message. Also wish there was a way to select HD videos on youtube instead of watching low definition content. Picasa is nice to view pictures on the internet. Have not tried renting videos. Wireless works fine.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I knew I'd get great quality video, audio and adaptability to other services (Netflix, etc;) but the interface with my main PC was an unexpected joy. Thru the built in WiFi I can access my photos AND recorded videos. TV I record on my PC plays great (using TV tuner card)and I wonder who really needs to pay for TiVo! We waited for this one and it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alman

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a player that does it all
customer_reviews.text: I bought the the LG BD570 Blu-Ray player on Cyber Monday from Amazon. It was back ordered but arrived in about a week. The player was very easy to set up and use. I got it connected to my receiver and to my wireless network without any difficulties. I was able to stream from Netflix within a few minutes. It was also simple to plug in my USB hard drive and play movies and look at photos. I haven't tried any Blu-Ray discs yet but assume that they will play just as easily. One tip... Make sure to change the default video out to 1080p if you're connecting to a HDTV that supports it.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2010. It's still working. It plays DVDs reasonably well although newer players have better error correction. If you rent DVDs or get some at the library it could be a problem. The network capability is only fair. Wireless is Wireless G. It works best with an ethernet connection and is picky about the router. I'll probably replace it next year or so.
customer_reviews.author: Joel FritzTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was researching and looking for a WiFi Blu-Ray player, and found this one. Compared it to some others and was reasonably priced with similar features. Purchased it, plugged it in, stepped through the setup, performed an update (after attaching to my wireless network) and was set to go. We have been streaming Netflix movies, listening to Pandora, watching Blu-ray and standard DVD's with excellent quality. I would recommend this player to anyone, good price, good quality and easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: DD99

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Was having trouble with our Roku box and was going to get a new one, but saw this and it was 50 bucks more...so thought I'd try it. It does work well with netflix and was easy to set up with wireless connection. The DVD player works well too. It seems to "fight through" the scratches etc. on the DVDs we so often get from netflix. It is a blu-ray player, but on our older TV it didn't make much difference when I compared a regular DVD with a blu-ray one. My only complaint with the player is it does not allow 16:9 unless the TV can handle higher resolution. Overall it has done well.
customer_reviews.author: jrplap

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product for the price. I've only watched 2 dvd's on it so far and have watched a few on netflix. On one of the movies I was getting an error reading the disc. I wasn't sure if it was the dvd or the player so I tried another one. The second worked fine. After that the original that I had a problem with worked ok. It seems a bit noisy when playing the discs. We had another dvd player but I wanted one that we could do streaming movies with netflix. This is great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player specifically for it's wireless DLNA streaming. The interface is a little clunky for this though as it doesn't seem to do a good job saving your directories and the views are kind of confusing for selecting files. It's easy enough for me to use, but not easy enough for my kids or wife to want to go through the hassle. Still, I'm happy with the player, it has excellent features and does what I want even if I have to help a bit in setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Thonus

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product now for about one month. The product setup was so easy. The one thing I was disappointed in was the slow speed and length of time to update the player via the internet. Of course I was hoping for more internet apps but perhaps there will be more in a later update. I connect to NetFlix via a wifi connection and am very pleased at how well it works. The quality of DVD play is also very good. I would buy this product again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Enough has been said already about this thing but it is awesome. I bought it about a month ago and I am amazed at what it can do for such a low price. Pulling movies, and pictures off a usb(front input) or my home network streaming media from the internet. I love it. Sorry that people complain about the load times, get over it, are people really so spoiled that it is a nuisance to wait 20 seconds? come on. This is an awesome product and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked perfectly right out of the box! Just plugged it in, easy onscreen display. Connected to Netflix, Wireless, as soon as I entered my code. Streams movies with no hesitation from my basement with computer upstairs. I love it when things are easy as they should be. Picture quality is clear and sharp and this going through a projector on a 8 foot home theater screen. 5 stars except for features as it does not play MP3 CD's. It does play regular CD's.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Reeder

customer_reviews.title: 3 years later ... Blue ray works great but weak/slow Netflix playing.
customer_reviews.text: Good overall. Some Netflix connection issues and not sure if player or Netflix is the issue. Built in WiFi rocks. Highly rated by top consumer magazine was the clincher. (After 3 years: it is working great and does everything it did when we took it out of the box! It does take about 20 seconds for Netflix to connect. Our Playstation 3 connects in about 3 seconds and has huge improvements in movie selection/speed, but it is 3 times more expensive too!)
customer_reviews.author: Ks Family

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this player for a couple of months now and have not had a single problem. I started with the Samsung bdc-6500 and found it not only to be user unfriendly, but I had a difficult time with the wi-fi. The LG set up was a breeze, wi-fi works really well and I love the nero home media program. Netflix runs perfect with my wi-fi. The only improvement I would make if I could is the Netflix interface, but I think that's a Netflix issue not LG. I wouldn't hesistate to recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Erieite

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit in Jan 2011 and it has not disappointed. Easy hook up and the apps are great. Once networked, you can view almost all your multimedia that is on you computers from your tv. If I can change one thing it would be a better app to view photos. I have Apple TV on one of my TVs and that device is the best ever for viewing photos due to ease of use. This DVD player is in my bedroom, so we do not use the photo view feature as much, but it is pretty weak.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Newman

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that clearly and easily detected and connected to our wi-fi during setup.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, one that clearly and easily detected and connected to our wi-fi during original setup. We have had it for 6 months and no issues so far. Looks nice. We have to make sure the LG BD570 is on for about 30 seconds before we switch the TV to our HDMI channel or we can't get to the Home screen. Simple thing. One surprise, entire front panel automatically flips down each time the disc tray comes out. We haven't had any problems with it. I like that it comes programmed with so many products like Netflix, Pandora, and many others.
customer_reviews.author: morkand

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: As a BD Player it works quite well. Picture quality is good and any complaints I would have would be the fault of the individual Bluray itself and not the player. DVD upconversion is pretty good. VUDU works quite well even wirelessly (the reason i bought it). netflix has a wicked sound delay after one firmware update that has never been fixed. If they could fix that I'd give it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: DB9

customer_reviews.title: Great way to see Netflix on line
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for different homes, specifically to watch Netflix on line. After a two month marathon of six seasons of "24," I am very pleased with the performance. Setup was easy. One is wireless and one is wired. There is little, if any, picture quality difference between the units . With the exception of Netflix and YouTube, I have not explored what this product can do. Even if I were never to do anything else with the units, they would still have been a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MaineWanderer

customer_reviews.title: LG BluRay
customer_reviews.text: Set up was generally very easy. It does require you to know what sort of encryption your network router uses and to have the password information available. The text entry can be tedious, but once you get past this the operation is very simple. The wireless connection works very well, even though our router is in a room at the other end of the house. Picture quality is excellent whether streaming video from Netflix or other services or watching a dvd or Bluray disc.
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: This Blue ray is an out performer looks , works ,sounds, responds like many more expensive ones don't
customer_reviews.text: This actually an over looked product that work in an outstanding manner in all aspects. the setting up was quick, the instructions could not be easier, to set up totally, I was watching netflix in 5 minutes, the sound usb or hdmi is outstanding and plays many formats others don't with an incredible sound. I have 2 OPPOs. and the best of all it does not have Cinavia Technology installed in it, that was my primary concern.
customer_reviews.author: Ricanguy007.

customer_reviews.title: Flawless results on BluRay and Net connections.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Bluray player over the last 5 years. The LG is fast and it doesnt lock up like many other players. The LG has no drama at all and does everything well. It updates itself through my network without any problems. The net connections are great. I stream my Netflix movies daily without any issues. I also stream movies,music,pics from my other computers using my local router. I am very happy with the LG. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PSUMountains

customer_reviews.title: How many hours does it take to update the firmware?
customer_reviews.text: I guess I may never know. 5 attempts and no luck. Downloaded the firmware to a usb drive and the player won't see it. Web site says firmware is 47mb. Player takes over 30 minutes to download, typically crashing after 20 minutes. Made it to the update part once and then frooze up while trying to update. Gave up a failure error 3 time and once it just turned off. It doesn't save the file, so you have to start all over every time it fails. From other reviews, this looks common.
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Streaming Success
customer_reviews.text: It is great. 15 minutes from box to watching Netflix. Don't forget to update the firmware, this is the part that took the most time. Check out the reviews for HDMI cables on [...] - Don't waste your money on anything pricey. I'd give it five stars but we've only had it a little over a month. You get five stars if you last at least a year. Update-2 years later it still works like new. No problems here, would buy again. 5 Stars now! 2017 and it still works great!
customer_reviews.author: J Mac

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: My command center was in the bedroom, from time to time my wife put me on the couch because she doesnt watch sic fi. I bought this product because my high end $1000.00 DVD PLAYER finally retired, boy have prices drop since then. I espeically like the wireless, it was easy to hookup , watching netflix was a breeze, I am more of an end user I dont want to get a College degree to use a product, just plug and play and I found thats exactly what I got , load time is ok picture is great.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great features...
customer_reviews.text: I had my two choices of Blu-Ray players narrowed down between the Sammy 6500 and the LG 570. After reading page after page of reviews, I decided to go with the LG BD-570. I'm glad I made that choice. WiFi took 2 minutes to get up and running. Picture quality is very good and the feature set is very user friendly. Load times do seem a little slow, but I don't have another BR player to compare it to. Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: broke after 78 days
customer_reviews.text: After about 60 days of trouble-free use, the player started freezing and skipping parts of movies. At first I suspected the discs. Then when it did this to a disc which was in perfect condition, I started to suspect the player. I tried the disc on another player and it played fine. So now I have to send the player back to LG under warranty. I give up trying to find a reliable brand any more :( There just aren't any left :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazonite

customer_reviews.title: great bluray player with great features
customer_reviews.text: got this on sale for under $150.00@amazon.com(other stores has it listed at around $220.00) plays blurays great plays dvd's great plays movie files from usb flash drive great have wifi hooked up and didn't expect it to stream this fast. (easy to setup wifi btw) netflix and Pandora work excellent. netflix does take maybe 15 seconds to load, but to me that it fast. no problems at all with this machine
customer_reviews.author: angelo

customer_reviews.title: Great network player
customer_reviews.text: Video casts work great, Netflix loads fast and does not interrupt. Wish it had more HDMI so I didn't have to connect it to my TV through my receiver. DLNA works great but Nero is a bit glitchy. Or it could be that I'm doing something wrong. I can't get it to stream from the computer internet. Movie files stream great wirelessly. Most of the time my music streams well but occasionally skips. One drawback is the interface for playing music. Has no options for playlists or random. I have to load a playlist in Nero but then I have duplicates of songs. Oh, and blue rays and dvds look beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Neil S

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this excellent Blu-ray/DVD player! Setup took, at the most, 10 minutes. The wireless connectivity is one of my favorite features. When the player went through the discovery process it found the network within seconds. It only took a few minutes to set up Netflix and I started watching movies. So far, DVD and Blu Ray DVD's haven't had any skips or problems and the picture is excellent. Not sorry I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: SECOND PLAYER IS A HIT
customer_reviews.text: FIRST PLAYER DIED THE SECOND TIME I USED IT. AMAZON REPLACED IT WITHOUT A FUSS AND THE SECOND PLAYER APPEARS TO BE WORKING FINE AFTER TWO WEEKS IN SERVICE. MANUAL DOES NOT TELL YOU THAT IT MAY BE NECESSARY TO MANUALLY SYNC THE DECK WITH YOUR TV. IF YOU FAIL TO DO THIS, THE SCREEN DISPLAYS A "NO SIGNAL" MESSAGE. ALSO THE MANUAL DOES NOT TELL YOU THE "PASSWORD" IN THE SET UP IS THE NUMBER ON YOUR ROUTER. OTHERWISE, THE SET UP WAS SIMPLE. I'M VERY PLEASED SO FAR.
customer_reviews.author: TRBSHOOT

customer_reviews.title: Too bad about the Bluray glitches and poor standard performance
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The blurays it plays look beautiful and the app functionality and interfaces are wonderful. Start speed is fast for a bluray. Cons: Two copies of the Ratatouille bluray freeze when the main character comes out of a window at the beginning, then skips forward several scenes. This doesn't happen on a Samsung player I tried. Standard DVDs look terrible, garbling faces that are farther away in the picture. It won't go straight to the top menu on many discs, forcing you to skip each preview. The forward and backward operations on disc are either too slow or too fast. I returned it, didn't want to risk exchanging for the same because other reviewers report similar bluray problems.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bock

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional and easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: This is our first blu-ray and our first LG product. Once we disconnected our old DVD player it took us under 5 minutes to connect this player. Once connected it took us only another minute or two to add the passcode (it comes up on the screen for you) and start watching Netflix. Note, we have wireless so we used HDMI cables (be sure yours are long enough) and the entire process took no time at all - what a pleasure!
customer_reviews.author: frequentshopper

customer_reviews.title: Can't play major BD disks and fails with BD Live
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PLAYER!! I am firmware current as of this writing, June 27, 2011. It still can not play The King's Speech and numerous BD Live sessions fail to initialize. That's the job of this player and it fails. Other specs are meaningless until LG fixes this. When an update fixes this i'll write some more updates. Look elsewhere for now. Too bad, it seemed like a nice player until it wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: J. Spiegel

customer_reviews.title: Love this Blu-ray player
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product because my research showed that it is a quality product, and it fits the need for streaming from NetFlix and other media. Using an ethernet connection was not feasible, so I had to have WIFI capability. There were some glitches at first with NetFlix, but that was soon resolved after a couple of firmware updates. I am quite pleased with the performance and found it at a great price on Amazon to boot.
customer_reviews.author: James Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great LG product
customer_reviews.text: Great companion for my LG TV. Practically did set up for me. Greatly improves the appearance of my Netflix rental movies. Can't believe I stuck with my old DVD player for so long. Spent a bit more than I originally planed but the extra dollars have been worth it. Have not explored all the features, but have no doubt they will work seamlessly as well. This product has great reviews and, even though an older model, it was my choice. No regrets
customer_reviews.author: M. Mc Glynn

customer_reviews.title: Sweet item!
customer_reviews.text: I had theand it froze on me while playing Pandora and the remote buttons were hard to press. After 1 day i returned it and found this LG for the same price. Night and day difference. All programs ran smooth, looks nicer, remote is easy to use and looks great, blu ray's load faster etc... I could go on and on, if you are checking reviews for the best affordable blu ray player with wifi look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Jouss

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic player and Internet Entertainment Hub!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this initially because it is the highest rated player I could find (loading, picture quality, etc.), and because its ability to hook up to my network wirelessly. However, the build-in Netflix, Pandora, etc. services make this box exceptional as it can now replace an old clunky laptop that I was using to route these services to my TV & A/V system. It really works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Love playing media from external Hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I love playing media from a external hard drive. It even provides power to an usb external drive, something that my western digital media player doesn't do. I can't give it 5 stars because I have problems getting the wireless to work. I was able to get netflix to work by prohibiting the BD Live, don't know if this was the fix or if that is just the point it started working. Being able to log into your napster is pretty sweet too.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 months it's exceeded expectations. Setup was relatively easy. It streams all kinds of content from my network drive. I've streamed HD material with very few glitches or hicups. Netflix etc works well from the apps page. BR's look great and it up-converts DVD's well. I liked the fact that when I put a BR disc in my (Panasonic) tv switched to input 1 automatically. Nothing really bad to say. I expected a few problems getting the networking going at least. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Loses HDMI signal intermittently
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated the BD570 an excellent product if not for one very annoying bug. When playing DVDs on it, it intermittently drops the HDMI video signal (audio continues playing though) for 2-4 seconds. I did not figure out it was a player problem until the 90-day warranty had expired so now I'm stuck with it. I finally found another review where the owner had the same issue. She was lucky enough to find the issue within the warranty period and have the unit replaced. So if you buy a BD570, I recommend you watch a few SD DVD's on it all the way through while it's under warranty to see if you have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love the built-in wireless and apps. Only complaint is that you are limited to the apps that come installed on the player - no options for new apps. Also now that I've had it for a few years, it is no longer receiving firmware updates so I assume they are no longer supporting this model (assumption). Plays DVD/Blu-ray well.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: This has every feature the average consumer would want (other than 3D). If you turn the unit on, it automatically changes the TV input to the player. I don't know if my TV or the player initiates this feature, however I use a Harmony remote that does all that anyway. I use the wireless connection which has been flawless so far, only takes about 10 seconds to buffer and start a movie with no interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a good player for the price. I actually find myself using the net services quite a bit, especially Pandora. However there does seem to be some universal problem with playing some of the most recent titles. Toy Story 3 will often pause and skip chapters. This has been widely reported in the internet. The latest firware fix did not fix this. Other titles for me seem to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: Has been good, but now
customer_reviews.text: Bought some time ago.Has been good, but now, Pandora, etc. keep disconnecting.( i am sure warrenty is gone) Will get a new one(another brand) and know for sure that it is the player that is the problem, but pretty sure.
customer_reviews.author: Middle Road

customer_reviews.title: Good overall but already found a BD it can't play
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this player. The Netcast features (especially for streaming Netflix) are very nice. But already I found a BD it can't play: Dexter Season 4 Disc 3: the player displays 'Error' and ejects the disc. The disc is fine since it can be played on a PS3 without problems. Strangely enough the LG player plays the other discs in the series perfectly. The firmware is up-to-date according to their tech support. I am waiting for their new firmware update to fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Basic Use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this after my $400 Sony Blu Ray player ceased functioning after about a year of use! This unit has lots of "wireless" capabilities for which I haven't made use of. Watching DVDs so far, has been just fine. Will attempt to use additional features soon but I do recommend this unit for watching movies. Very easy and great performance, which, should be as expected.
customer_reviews.author: cmac

customer_reviews.title: major wifi issues
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this blu-ray player works well, amazing picture. But the main reason I purchased it was for the wifi capability. The blu-ray player would not recognize my wireless network not matter how close I moved the router, also I live in a townhouse and my old Roku would recognize several of my neighbor's wireless networks. This blu-ray player did not recognize ANY wireless networks. I upgraded the firmware and that did not help. I also contacted LG and they basically told me that my wireless router was too far away from the blu-ray player. I purchased a Sony Bravia LED TV, which has the wifi capability, and it works just fine with my router.
customer_reviews.author: Andy J. Ussery

customer_reviews.title: LG Wireless Bluray player
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding price for this excellent player. Easy to set up as this was my first Bluray I took a little time to read everything which wasnt needed as the screens walk you through step by step. Wireless connectivity was easy as the player found my airport router in less that a minute. Free shipping from Amazon was a bonus plus knowing if I had a problem it would be an easy return process.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this blu-ray player alot. The features are very good and I really like all the included features like Pandora, Weather.com, YouTube, etc. Very easy to install and use. The viewing is crisp and the playback is also very good. I have not used the wireless yet, which is why I bought it, but hooked directly to my cable modem it works fine. I dont like the menu as much as the newer models and I dont like that there is not a "search" option to look for movies while you are on the screen. Other than that, Im enjoying it very much
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great Player
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about how easy it would be to set up with my Linksys wireless router. I was really surprised how simple it was. It was "Apple Easy" is was so simple. I never even cracked the manual. I plugged my Flip into the USB port and it automatically found it with no issues. For me this thing just worked right out of the box. You will need to buy an HD cable.
customer_reviews.author: Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Works great right out of the box like everyone says. Don't forget to check 1080p if that's your thing. The guide says it's supposed to be able to rip CDs onto external storage, this did not work for me but I did not spend any time trying to figure it out. Netflix works great. Home media sharing works but is a bit slow seemingly. Plays BluRay and every DVD I have thrown at it just great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Ludden

customer_reviews.title: LG  top quality
customer_reviews.text: couldn't ask for more ...got Netflix up and running in no time, and streaming video (direct hookup) looks just like satellite quality on 55inch plasma... haven't tried HD streaming mode yet, but can't see how much video improvement is available anyway neat to be hooked into LAN and do a slide show directly from desktop PC sub-directories to HD screen ... would like to have a auto slide show mode, but that may be an app somewhere?? need to do more DD
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Corman

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: I have had no problem with this Blu-ray player at all over several years. It downloads software updates to stay current. It works fine with Netflix streaming. I do have to keep a thumb drive sticking out of the front to have enough memory to function all the extra features on some of the new movies.
customer_reviews.author: DINKDivers

customer_reviews.title: EZ setup no extras needed
customer_reviews.text: It took few minutes to setup the wireless and that was it.and few seconds to connect to Netflix. The auto update feature lets you get the latest software if you select it. picture quality is Awesome. menu is ez to navigate. it has a lot of features. solid built and classy looking. The only con is I wish I had bought two.
customer_reviews.author: R. L

customer_reviews.title: lg bd 570
customer_reviews.text: Dont you just love the reviews "Just got it from amazon today, havent used it yet, but looks great...5 stars." Anyways, I have had this bluray player for 2 years now and love it. Cant beat it for the price (even what I paid 2 years ago). It has frozen a few times but what player doesnt. I honestly use it at least once a day (I watch movies at night before going to bed). Netflix feature works great too. Dont know what else to say as I havent had any problems with it and it has been in use for a solid 2 years. It has passed the test and cant be beat for a cheap bluray player.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley F. Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Great Entertainment Value
customer_reviews.text: I had no problems setting up this player or integrating it into into my home wifi network using an Apple Airport Extreme router. Blu-ray discs load quickly and the picture is awesome. We're really enjoying streaming Netflix movies and the quality has been as good as cable TV, with no hiccups or buffering once the title loads from Netflix. For the money, the LG BD570 is a great entertainment value.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a BLU RAY PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I play blu ray about half way through the movie I lose picture and audio and sometimes it freezes. Getting it running again is a pain. I use to love LG and I do love their TVs, however knowing how many people are having the same problems with their blu ray players and no fixes are forthcoming, I won't feel comfortable buying another from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Sheshechic

customer_reviews.title: It is beyond a Blu-Ray
customer_reviews.text: Not only great blu-ray. I love all the features that came with it. I'm using all the apps that came on board. You really don't use the player since you can have all the HD movies you can access. I love the fact that you can access all your PC's within your network (Pics, Movies, Music) with speed. No need for your MP3 player to access your collection. User friendly and intuitive setup. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sinjil

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Blu-ray player purchase. I spent several hours researching on the internet and consumer reports before purchasing. It's easy to install, the remote is easy to understand, the picture is wonderful, the box is sleek looking, and movies look great with my Sony Bravia 40 KDL40V4100 via Blu-ray/DVD or Netflix streaming. I am very pleased with this purchase and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: trvl_grl

customer_reviews.title: Decent for 2010
customer_reviews.text: A little slow, inconvenient that you have to physically remove the disc before any updates can be performed on the software. Had a couple of issues with Netflix not loading and Pandora randomly shutting down. But it was a good 'starter' Bluray player.
customer_reviews.author: S. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Great value for Blu-Ray & Netflix
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research online and reading reviews, I chose the LG BD570. I've had now for about 2 months and it has worked flawlessly. Wireless streaming of Netflix delivers clear picture and sound. Blu-ray discs are quick to load (less than 2 minutes) and I haven't had any issues with device. I'm really happy with it. For the basics that I need which are blu-ray and Netflix, I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BD570 - Luv it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this BluRay Player about a month ago. This is an Internet Connectable and Wireless (Wi-Fi) Enabled BluRay player. Me and my family luv it very much. Everyone knows that its a BluRay Player but its main feature is its Netcast System from LG. This is the best thing that can happen after Netflix, Youtube, Picasaweb, Vudu, Accuweather, Cinemanow. Why? Because this BluRay Player has all these features as part of the Netcast system. You don't even need any Internet wires because you can use your existing wireless network (or Wire) to connect to the internet and watch all the applications described above. This is simply beyond good. Its the best.
customer_reviews.author: strategyguy

customer_reviews.title: exactly what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our newborn sons room so we could watch TV, movies, or listen to music in his room when we feed him, etc. It works great and we love that it has Netflix and Pandora built in. I love everything about this player. It turns on and off quickly and the menus are easy to navigate. I plan to buy another one of these players soon for a different room.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fokema

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Great player. Does everything as advertised. Minor issues with some of the AVI files not getting fast-forwarded correctly with multiple speeds, or minor sync issues after fast-forwarding AVI files on an external storage only. Happened only on a small subset of AVI files, otherwise everything worked beautifully. Netflix, and DIVX TV playback is really great. Had to update the firmware for the Netflix playback. So far, very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: P. Vaidya

customer_reviews.title: Best BR player in Price range
customer_reviews.text: Sony BDP-S360: crappy netflix interface, no DLNA compatibility. LG BD-550: No DLNA comp. no WiFi. Samsung BD-C6500: Super slow operation, Wifi that works 1/3 of the time, no DLNA. Finally got the only reasonably priced Blu-ray player w/ the ability to stream from the internet AND your network drive--LG BD570. Of course now it's discontinued. They still have a few on Amazon. Get 'em while you can!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: From a Techno-dummy for setting up netflix, you-tube interface, etc.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, paired with a Toshiba 47" HD flat screen TV also purchased at Amazon earlier this spring. Picture quality very good, like the features of count time, pausing , still, etc. Even with older movies, shows converted to HD, the quality is great. I would recommend this product to the consumer who wants ease of operation, but that even tech challenged older people c an use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gies

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Quickest set up of any wireless Blu-ray player I've owned. Works best connected to wired ethernet or wireless bridge, but does fine on its own at locating a wireless router signal for Netflix (although on its own the signal detection may not be good enough for firmware updates). One drawback is that its remote will not code for my Sharp Aquos HDTV
customer_reviews.author: Gerald H. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this BluRay player...I now own 2 of them. Not only does it play BluRay & standard DVDs, but it also plays a burned DVD disc with everything from AVI, MKV, XviD, DivX, H264, 720p, 1080i...and even better that I can also play all those via a USB drive in the front of the player! It's also super sleek and not too deep.
customer_reviews.author: Poptartsgurl

customer_reviews.title: Does not stream Netfix in Canada
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed with LG for not providing a fix so I can access Netflix when i am in Canada. I bought the unit back in Nov/Dec 2010 and still nothing. I also bought a Sony player around the same time and it was the same problem. However, within a few months Sony provided a fix. The next time I am buying electronics, guess which manufacturer I will avoid?
customer_reviews.author: ewnaly

customer_reviews.title: BD570 Great Features
customer_reviews.text: The LG BD570 is a great blu-ray player. Not only does it perform very well when playing blu-ray discs, but its NetCast features are pretty good as well (although I wish they would add more of them). Very sleek design and great to look at, even before turning on. Paired with the LG42LE5400 TV, this combination is hard to beat. Wireless connection streams flawlessly for the most part, have had some cut outs while playing Pandora, but while streaming movies on VUDU the picture quality is great, in HD, just not HDX (the next step up). Wireless connection was also very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby1322

customer_reviews.title: First Blu-Ray Blew Me Away
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Love it. Love it. We bought this product more for the Netflix feature than the Blu-Ray. I took my tv addicted family off of our $75 Dish plan and replaced it with a $10 Netflix plan. The wireless streaming feature works seamlessly. I turn it on, click a button, then I'm looking at my Netflix queue. Rented Blu-Rays look phenomenal on our 1080 tv. This is our best purchase this year.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnsen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: If available, I would give this unit 9 1/2 stars - it is very user-friendly. Within 20 minutes out of the box, the LG BD570 was set up and connected to NetFilx via wifi. This contrasted to the 4 hours spent wrestling with a Samsung BD C6500 which was returned to Amazon. The Nero software is the only negative.
customer_reviews.author: W8ZOJ

product_meta.title: LG BD570 Network Blu-ray Disc Player (2010 Model)
product_meta.description:
BD-P, Netflix, YouTube, CinemaNow, BD Live, Advanced Audio, Quick Booting, 1GB Memory, Wireless 802.11n, DLNA, 7.1ch Analog Output, Instant Tray Open, 1080p up-scaling for DVD, USB Media Host

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The BD570 Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player offers wireless access to NetCast™, bringing you the best movies, TV shows and more from Internet, directly to your television screen. That, plus the ability to upscale your DVDs and play Blu-Ray Discs in amazing Full 1080p with Dolby® sound assures you of the total home entertainment experience. 



INNOVATIVE FEATURES
Less Clutter. More Possibilities.
Cut loose from messy wires. Integrated WiFi Connecticity allows you to take advantage of NetCast™ Entertainment Access from any available Wi-FI connection, anywhere in its range.

Entertainment On Tap
The end of "there’s nothing on." NetCast™ Entertainment Access lets you stream instant, and virtually endless, entertainment from Netflix®, Vudu™, CinemaNow™, Pandora®, YouTube™, Picasa™ and AccuWeather® direct to your TV from the Internet- no computer required. (Learn more)

The Feature Is Yours
Access videos, photos and music from your home network through this DLNA certified media player. This feature brings digital entertainment libraries within easy reach to the big screen.

Enjoy It at It's Best
Make the most of your HDTV. Blu-Ray Disc™ playback delivers exceptional Full 1080p video performance.

Making Old Just Like New
No need to go out and replace your old DVD collection. Even they look better on Blu-Ray. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs with 1080p Up-Scaling via HDMI™ output. (Learn more)

Don’t just hear it. Feel it.
Great picture needs great sound. Get Superior Audio Performance that supports surround sound up to 7.1 channels with Dolby® Digital Plus, Dolby® TrueHD and dts-HD Advanced Digital Out technologies. (Learn more)

Don’t Wait To Watch
A quick-opening tray- ready to play before you hit the couch.

Memories on the big screen
Want to view a highlight reel of the family vacation in the comfort of your living room? USB Media Host lets you view family photos, and listen to music from USB storage devices. (Learn more)

All In One
Having a hard time keeping track of your remotes? With SIMPLINK™, all your LG devices can be controlled with just one remote. (Learn more)

Export Full Digital Sound 
Deliver full digital sound quality from your Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player to your television with optical and coaxial audio output connectivity.




LEARN MORE
NetCast™ Entertainment
Now buying a Blu-ray player from LG can also mean getting access to virtually endless entertainment and services from the Internet. Want to watch your favorite action film? If you have an LG Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player with NetCast™ Entertainment Access and an Internet connection, select an onscreen service and you’ll be enjoying it in moments. Tapping into virtually endless entertainment from the Internet no longer requires a computer or messy wires. This is the future of entertainment, and it’s available now with LG.

Roxio CinemaNow™
Now Hollywood’s latest hits can be viewed any time you want. With CinemaNow™, LG consumers can get instant access to pay-per-view movies from major studios directly to any LG Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player. Find major release titles, along with broadcast and cable television programs. The entire premium content catalog can be browsed directly and selections can be watched instantly. CinemaNow™ and LG have redefined what can be expected of digitally available entertainment. 

Netflix®
Make the most of the extensive offerings on Netflix®. Users with a subscription can sit back and enjoy unlimited instant access to over 12,000 Netflix® movies and TV episodes* streamed directly to their TV set. Most movies and TV episodes appear in standard definition and many selections are not new releases.

Netflix® subscription required and sold separately.

YouTube™
Now you can watch everything on YouTube™ right in your living room. Blu-ray players with NetCast™ give you unlimited, direct access to the millions of Web videos available through YouTube™, whenever you want them. All you need is an active Internet connection. Watch that one fellow making a fool of himself over and over again.

Vudu™
If you want major studio releases in Full HD 1080p and Dolby® Digital Plus sound, Vudu™ is the only place you’ll find it. With 20,000 HD titles available, and 2,000 in Blu-ray-quality HDX format, there’s no better source for streaming HD movies on NetCast™. 

Pandora®
Listen to a radio station made just for you. By entering artist or song information, Pandora® will generate a playlist of similar recommendations. Your new favorite song is waiting.

Picasa™
Edit digital photos so they look their best when shared on your television screen, and create galleries and slideshows for easy organization any time you want to enjoy them.

Accuweather®
Get up to the minute weather updates, plus forecast information to help plan ahead.




Standard DVD Up-Scaling
It’s not just Blu-Ray Discs that look great on a Blu-Ray Disc™ Player. Standard DVD Up-Scaling delivers exceptional image quality from standard DVDs to near full HD picture quality. That means even your older movies and shows look better on an LG Network Blu-Ray Disc™ Player.




Superior Audio Performance
Blu-ray lets you enjoy the best sound available from your movies and shows. Supports surround sound up to 7.1 channels with Dolby® Digital Plus, Dolby® TrueHD and dts-HD Advanced Digital Out technologies.




USB 2.0 Media Host
